question:
Consider the following:
  1. Medicines with active Pharmaceutical Ingredients
  2. Cardiac Stents
  3. Orthopaedic Implants
Which of the above are classified as "drugs" under Indian Law?
explanation:
The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare recently notified that medical equipment would qualify as ‘drugs’ under the 1940 Drugs and Cosmetics Act from April 2020 onwards.
The manufacturer of the devices must register them online.
 The newly amended rules require the manufacturers to register the medical devices with the Central Licensing Authority. The manufacturers are required to provide information like name and address of the manufacturing firm and also the certificate of compliance. The move is expected to bring in quality assurance for medical devices sold in India.
The ‘Online System for Medical Devices’ was established by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation.
The manufacturers will be registering the medical devices online through the ‘Online System for Medical devices’. The system was established by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation. The Drug Technical Advisory Board had recommended that all medical devices be notified as ‘drugs’ to ensure safety and quality.
Imported devices are also covered by the rules
Medical devices that are manufactured in India and also those imported from elsewhere are covered by the amended rules. It covers devices used for diagnosis, treatment, prevention and also mitigation of diseases. It even includes items like hypodermic syringes and needles, lenses and sutures.
